physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 70 to 80 asymptomatic skin-colored papular lesions, ranging from 3 to 5 mm, on upper trunk, shoulders, neck, arms, forearms, elbows, and periumbilical areas. Pruritic, slightly pigmented lesions with a rippled pattern on shoulders and interscapular region.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The number of papular lesions increased steadily at a rate of 2 to 3 per year.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Euthyroid nodular grade IB goiter with a dominant nodule of 1 cm on the left lobe. No palpable lymph nodes in the neck. Ultrasonographic examination revealed isoechoic nodule in the right lobe and a calcified nodule in the left lobe.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcitonin value of 64.8 pg/mL and 193.8 pg/mL (reference range, 0-30 pg/ml) on two tests.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal findings in routine laboratory examination including serum calcium and phosphate. Normal chest x-ray, systemic examination, and eye examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No major changes in the papular lesions during follow-up; serum calcitonin and vanylmandelic acid levels were normal during follow-up.
